org.apache.jackrabbit.core.cluster
Interface Journal

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileJournal
public interface Journal

Journal interface. Defines operations on a journal that are used to synchronize clustered repository nodes.

Method Summary
 void begin(String workspace)
          Start an update operation on the journal.
 void cancel()
          End this update operation and discards changes made to the journal.
 void close()
          Close this journal.
 void commit()
          End this update operation and definitely write changes to the journal.
 void init(String id, RecordProcessor processor, NamespaceResolver resolver)
          Initialize journal.
 void log(ChangeLog changes, EventStateCollection esc)
          Add item state operations to the journal.
 void log(Collection ntDefs)
          Log on or more node type registrations or reregistration.
 void log(NodeId nodeId)
          Log an unlock operation.
 void log(NodeId nodeId, boolean isDeep, String owner)
          Log a lock operation.
 void log(String oldPrefix, String newPrefix, String uri)
          Log a namespace registry operation.
 void prepare()
          Prepare an update operation on the journal.
 void sync()
          Synchronize contents from journal.
 

Method Detail

init

public void init(String id,
                 RecordProcessor processor,
                 NamespaceResolver resolver)
          throws JournalException
Initialize journal.

Parameters:
id - id this journal should use to write its own records
resolver - namespace resolver used to map prefixes to URIs and vice-versa.
processor - to invoke when new records are processed
Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

sync

public void sync()
          throws JournalException
Synchronize contents from journal.

Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

public void begin(String workspace)
           throws JournalException
Start an update operation on the journal.

Parameters:
workspace - workspace name, may be null
Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

public void log(ChangeLog changes,
                EventStateCollection esc)
         throws JournalException
Add item state operations to the journal.

Parameters:
changes - changes to transfer
Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

log

public void log(NodeId nodeId,
                boolean isDeep,
                String owner)
         throws JournalException
Log a lock operation.

Parameters:
nodeId - node id
isDeep - flag indicating whether lock is deep
owner - lock owner
Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

         throws JournalException
Log an unlock operation.

Parameters:
nodeId - node id
Throws:

                String newPrefix,
                String uri)
         throws JournalException
Log a namespace registry operation.

Parameters:
oldPrefix - old prefix
newPrefix - new prefix
uri - URI
Throws:

log

public void log(Collection ntDefs)
         throws JournalException
Log on or more node type registrations or reregistration.

Parameters:
ntDefs - node type definitions
Throws:
JournalException

prepare

public void prepare()
             throws JournalException
Prepare an update operation on the journal. This locks the journal exclusively for updates until this client either invokes cancel() or commit(). If a conflicting intermittent change is detected, this method should throw an exception, signaling that the whole update operation should be undone.

Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

commit

public void commit()
            throws JournalException
End this update operation and definitely write changes to the journal.

Throws:
JournalException - if an error occurs

cancel

public void cancel()
End this update operation and discards changes made to the journal.

close

public void close()
Close this journal. This should release any resources still held by this journal.
